job_title: Summer Camp Instructor in Seattle, WA
pros: Very knowledgeable team. Taught me more than my university did about teaching and engaging children. Extremely understanding of any individual or group needs. Super tight-knit family. Employers and employees are all friends, and all more than happy to invite more people into the fold. This also means that, once you have worked for them once, you have a great chance of being hired back, either for the same position or a different one. Lots of room for growth. Wonderful children.
cons: You have to really love kids for the job. It can be very tedious at times, but if you do love working with children, you will end each week feeling very fulfilled.

pros: competitive pay, welcoming culture, wonderful place to work.
cons: Sometimes the culture fat phobia was present, and made it uncomfortable at times.
More events throughout the job experience would have been nice.

review_title: Growing mentors and leaders for a sustainable, nature connected world
job_title: Instructor Wilderness Awareness in Duvall, WA
pros:
1.) Warm, creative, people centered culture
2.) powerful misison and vision
3.) leader in the 8 shields Deep Nature Connection movement
4.) fun and creative place to work with strong roots
5.) people you want to not only work with but play and live with
6.) vitality and aliveness is present in the staff, students, Elders, Board
cons:
Maybe cons, but a challenges: 
- High level of communication and peacemaking required of all
- Non-proft struggle with always wanting to do more with limited resources

review_title: Dyanmic nature based school with rich, passion based culture
pros: Powerful, rich culture; meaningful mission; decentralized leadership; passion based work; creative environment; outstanding change leaders as co-workers; nature based community; great paid time off; compassionate work place; work with kids, teens, adults and elders.
cons: Tight-knit community blends professional and personal relationships to a high degree.  This is also a pro.  Low pay.  irregular hours and extra time outside of work day often needed to fufill mission

review_title: Feels like a family that acknowledges your gifts, and nudges you to keep growing.
pros:
-Professional, yet laid-back workplace
-Expectation of continuous growth of everyone
-Feedback encouraged throughout the organization
-Emphasis on work/life balance
-Focus on quality without micromanagement
cons:
-As with any non-profit, mission-based work it is easy to overwork
-Sometimes hard to pay enough to retain experienced staff - who will have to switch fields to earn more

pros: This is a fun, amazing place to work full of dedicated, creative, and  intelligent people working together for a great cause.
cons: The work can sometimes be very demanding emotionally and otherwise.  But it is totally worth it.

review_title: Amazing group of people and organization!
pros:
-Expectation of continuous growth 
-Focus on quality without micromanagement
-Flexibility and recognition of people's lives outside of the organization
cons:
-Easy to overwork when you love something so much!
-Hard to pay enough to retain experienced staff

review_title: Amazing outdoors job in a rich culture.
pros: Nature, Mentoring Model, Culture, Do Good for the world, generous time off.
cons: Poor Pay, little room for advancement
